frameDefinitions: These are words that describe basic commercial transactions involving a Buyer and a Seller who exchange Money and Goods.
These are words describing a basic commercial transaction involving a Buyer and a Seller exchanging Money and Goods, taking the perspective of the Buyer.
A Lessee gains the use of Goods owned by a Lessor by payment to the Lessor.
An Agent attempts to achieve a Goal using some Means.
These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller.
These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator takes Goods from a  Victim or a Source.
frameExamples: His $20 <t>transaction</t> with Amazon.com for a new TV had been very smooth.
Abby bought a car from Robin for $5,000.
We are <t>renting</t> our apartment from a kind man named Tom.
John <t>tried</t> using a crowbar to open the door.
Robin <t>sold</t> a car to Abby for $5,000.
I can't believe he <t>pickpocketed</t> my gold watch !
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Buyer</fen> wants the <fen>Goods</fen> and offers <fen>Money</fen> to a <fen>Seller</fen> in exchange for them.
The role Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction.
Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> wants the <fen>Goods</fen> and offers <fen>Money</fen> to a <fen>Seller</fen> in exchange for them.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The individual that gains temporary use of the <fen>Goods</fen> by paying the <fen>Lessor</fen>
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is an item which is temporarily exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
When the event occurs.
The location the renting takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
This role identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an attempt occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where an attempt is made.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
<fen>Perpetrator</fen> is the person (or other agent) that takes the goods away.
<fen>Victim</fen> is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the goods before they are taken away by the perpetrator.
<fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away.
<fen>Source</fen> is the initial location of the goods, before they change location.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the theft occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the theft occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>We</fex> 've been renting from him for years .
I rented the car <fex>right next to the airport</fex> .
John tried using a crowbar <fex>to enter the locked door</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he tried the crowbar.
So far, <fex>my company</fex> has sold more than three million copies.
Leslie stole the watch <fex>from the table</fex>.
Leslie STOLE the watch from Kim <fex>at dusk</fex>.
Leslie STOLE the watch from Kim <fex>in the park</fex>.
